name: Unavoid un-deallocated variables or arrays in Fortran-90 Programs  (FORTRAN)
associatedValueName: Number of allocate statements without deallocate
description:
The number of Allocate statements is compared to the number of Deallocate statements. More allocate statements than deallocate statements indicates un-allocated variables from memory.
Note: This Rule considers pointers as well as arrays for violation.
rationale: If an array or variable is not de-allocated, memory is not freed up. This main lead to memory issues. Advised standard is to both limit the use of ALLOCATE and to make sure that variables are de-allocated from memory
remediation: Make sure each allocated variable is deallocated in the same artifact.
alternativeName: Unavoid un-deallocated variables or arrays in Fortran-90 Programs  (FORTRAN)
